author: BBC News
description:
US President Donald Trump has suggested some TV networks should have their licences "taken away", as he backed America's broadcast regulator in a row over the suspension of ABC host Jimmy Kimmel.
 
The Disney-owned network announced on Wednesday evening it was pulling the comedian off air "indefinitely" amid a backlash over his remarks about the murder of conservative influencer Charlie Kirk last week.
 
On Monday, Kimmel suggested the suspect was a Maga Republican, although authorities in Utah had said the alleged gunman was "indoctrinated with leftist ideology".
 
ABC took Jimmy Kimmel Live! off air after the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) threatened action over his remarks.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#JimmyKimmel #BBCNews
title: Donald Trump says ‘negative’ TV networks could lose licences after Kimmel suspension | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Brazil's President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has told the BBC in an exclusive interview that he has "no relationship" with US President Donald Trump.
 
Lula has frequently criticised Trump, but this is the clearest signal yet that he thinks communication between him and his US counterpart is now broken.
 
Even though the US has a trade surplus with Brazil, Donald Trump imposed 50% tariffs on Brazilian goods in July. He cited the trial on coup charges of Brazil's right-wing former president Jair Bolsonaro as a trigger. Lula described the tariffs as "eminently political".
 
The two leaders have never spoken directly to each other. Trump has previously said that Lula can "call him anytime" - but Lula insisted that members of the Trump Administration "do not want to talk".
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#Brazil #US #BBCNews
title: I have no relationship with Trump, Brazil's President Lula tells BBC | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
There are currently no test to look for early signs of pancreatic cancer, which means survival rates are lower than for many other cancers. 
 
The disease often has vague symptoms and can lead to death within months of diagnosis.
 
BBC Tech Now’s Lara Lewington explores a new medical trial looking to change that, which involves evaluating a blood test that might detect the disease at it’s earliest stages.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#Health #Technology #BBCNews
title: Detecting ‘hidden’ pancreatic cancer cases | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
US President Donald Trump and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer held a news conference on Thursday afternoon.
 
The pair were questioned on numerous topics, including international conflicts, social media and immigration policies, at the conference during Trump's visit to the UK.
 
Trump and First Lady Melania have since departed the UK on board Air Force One after the two-day state visit.

title: Trump and Starmer on free speech, immigration and TikTok | BBC News

title: Putin has ‘let me down’, says Trump. #DonaldTrump #VladimirPutin #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
In an interview with Amol Rajan for his BBC podcast, Radical, Edward Enninful says "anti-woke" and anti-diversity rhetoric is having "a moment", and that being super-thin and European are often seen as the beauty norm again in the world of fashion.
 
Enninful, who has co-founded a new media business called EE72, explains why he left British Vogue and talks about his relationship with his former boss, Anna Wintour.
 
He also discusses the recent Sydney Sweeney jeans advert after the US fashion retailer American Eagle ran ads with her alongside the words: "Sydney Sweeney has great jeans".
 
You can listen to the full interview on BBC Sounds: https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/m002jfd2
 
You can also watch Radical with Amol Rajan on BBC iPlayer: https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episodes/m002f1d0/radical-with-amol-rajan

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Vogue#BBCNews
title: Edward Enninful on his time at Vogue, Anna Wintour and being ‘woke’ in fashion | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
US President Donald Trump and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer are holding a joint press conference at the PM’s country home Chequers.
 
It comes as the leaders sign a "technology prosperity deal", with major US tech firms pledging tens of billions of pounds in UK investment.
 
Addressing the war in Ukraine, the UK PM said Russian President Vladimir Putin has shown his true face, with the world seeing "yet more bloodshed”.
 
While Trump said that Putin has "let me down”.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#DonaldTrump #KeirStarmer #BBCNews
title: Trump says Putin 'let me down' as Starmer calls for 'extra pressure' on Russian leader | BBC News

title: Melania Trump and Queen Camilla visit dolls’ house. #RoyalFamily #MelaniaTrump #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
Local residents and eyewitnesses said dozens of Israeli tanks and military vehicles have pushed into a major residential district of Gaza City, on the second day of Israel's ground offensive aimed at occupying the area.
 
Video footage showed tanks, bulldozers and armoured personnel moving on the edges of Sheikh Radwan, in northern Gaza City.
 
The district was home to thousands of people before the war and is considered one of the city's most densely populated areas.
 
Israel said the aim of its Gaza City offensive is to free hostages held by Hamas and defeat up to 3,000 fighters in what it describes as the group's "last stronghold" - but the operation has drawn widespread international criticism.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Gaza #Israel #BBCNews
title: Israeli tanks push further into Gaza City | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
ABC has pulled late-night host Jimmy Kimmel off air indefinitely over comments he made about the shooting of right-wing influencer Charlie Kirk.
 
"Jimmy Kimmel Live will be pre-empted indefinitely," a spokesperson for the Disney-owned network said in a statement.
 
Earlier this week, Kimmel said during his show that the "Maga gang" was trying to score political points off Kirk's killing.
 
Kimmel did not comment to the BBC as he emerged shortly after the announcement from the television studio in Los Angeles.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#JimmyKimmel #JimmyKimmelLive #CharlieKirk #US #BBCNews
title: Jimmy Kimmel taken off air over Charlie Kirk comments | BBC News
